oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report of Railroad Mail Service, March 1953
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This item is a business record of the Fonda, Johnstown & Gloversville (FJ&G) Railroad Company that details the charges for the railroad mail service performed for the month of March, 1953. This is a U.S. Post Office Dept. Form 2531.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Job Application for conductor for the Fonda, Johnstown & Gloversville Railroad Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is application no. 629 (Form 42) for the position of conductor on the Fonda, Johnstown & Gloversville Railroad (FJ&G RR), Cayadutta (Steam) Division. This application was completed by William Henry Mount Abel on June 7, 1910, handed in on June 8, 1910, and accepted by M.H. Collins, General Superintendent, on June 20, 1910.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Terrible Storm
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a handbill distributed the day of the Johnstown, NY flood. Several lives lost ; bridges belonging to the New York Central and Fonda, Johnstown and Gloversville Railroad companies (FJ&G) were taken away.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pioneer : the locomotive used in building the FJ&G Railroad
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Fonda, Johnstown & Gloversville railroad locomotive was purchased from the Manchester Locomotive Works, builder's no. 249, during late summer of 1870. The cost of this engine was $10,500. It was renamed David A. Wells after its 1873 rebuilding in honor of the company's vice-president.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Broadalbin Railroad Station
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a south view of the first Broadalbin train station of the Fonda, Johnstown & Gloversville Railroad (FJ&G); the Kennyetto Creek runs parallel with the tracks. The railroad depot still exists in its current location, but it is used as a coffee shop today.
